body_html:
Latest commits add the following:

  1. All pooling autograd functions are now at least new-style with non-differentiable backwards.
  2. AvgPool1d, AvgPool2d, LPPool2d, AvgPool3d, MaxPool1d, MaxPool2d now support double backwards.
  3. MaxPool3d has a MaxPool3dBackwards function whose backwards is not implemented yet because the indices returned are inconsistent with how they are returned in the 1d/2d case, see #1197 for more details.
body_text:
Latest commits add the following:

All pooling autograd functions are now at least new-style with non-differentiable backwards.
AvgPool1d, AvgPool2d, LPPool2d, AvgPool3d, MaxPool1d, MaxPool2d now support double backwards.
MaxPool3d has a MaxPool3dBackwards function whose backwards is not implemented yet because the indices returned are inconsistent with how they are returned in the 1d/2d case, see #1197 for more details.
body:
Latest commits add the following:
1) All pooling autograd functions are now at least new-style with non-differentiable backwards.
2) AvgPool1d, AvgPool2d, LPPool2d, AvgPool3d, MaxPool1d, MaxPool2d now support double backwards.
3) MaxPool3d has a MaxPool3dBackwards function whose backwards is not implemented yet because the indices returned are inconsistent with how they are returned in the 1d/2d case, see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1197 for more details.
